rComments: Alex's studio classes are extremely intense. We would often be expected to meet with him outside of class, at short notice, on weekends, to discuss our projects. Overall the class was very rewarding, and I improved greatly over the semester. However, the stress of the course was insane and I'm not sure I would put myself through it again.

Alex is clearly a talented designer, but - as many talented people are - I found him to be difficult personality-wise and not that great at teaching. He undoubtedly plays favorites and grades accordingly. Unless he takes a liking to your work and/or personality, you will suffer in his class (note: genuine hard work will not save you either).

Tough and picky prof. Really harsh. Offers good advise though but he looks for perfection. Would call your work as garbage if he doesnt like it. For one wants a high GPA, dont take his class! Will never take his class again! You will learn, but unpleasantly.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: It's a challenge but probably the most valuable studio he teaches
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Alex is one of the most talented architects in the city. Visit Bar Raval at 505 College street and see his work in person. His class is difficult - architecture is difficult. If your serious about this, take his class, having Alex as a prof is an incredible opportunity and you will learn a ton.  If you want your ego stroked, go somewhere else.
Extremely critical. Learned more from the teaching assistants than him. Would never take again.
